00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 # pygame + PyOpenGL version of Nehe's OpenGL lesson03
00003 # Paul Furber 2001 - m@verick.co.za
00004 
00005 from OpenGL.GL import *
00006 from OpenGL.GLU import *
00007 import pygame
00008 from pygame.locals import *
00009 
00010 
00011 def resize((width, height)):
00012     if height==0:
00013         height=1
00014     glViewport(0, 0, width, height)
00015     glMatrixMode(GL_PROJECTION)
00016     glLoadIdentity()
00017     gluPerspective(45, 1.0*width/height, 0.1, 100.0)
00018     glMatrixMode(GL_MODELVIEW)
00019     glLoadIdentity()
00020 
00021 def init():
00022     glShadeModel(GL_SMOOTH)
00023     glClearColor(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
00024     glClearDepth(1.0)
00025     glEnable(GL_DEPTH_TEST)
00026     glDepthFunc(GL_LEQUAL)
00027     glHint(GL_PERSPECTIVE_CORRECTION_HINT, GL_NICEST)
00028 
00029 def draw():
00030     glClear(GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT|GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT)
00031     glLoadIdentity()
00032 
00033     glTranslatef(-1.5, 0.0, -6.0)
00034 
00035     glBegin(GL_TRIANGLES)
00036     glColor3f(1.0, 0.0, 0.0)
00037     glVertex3f(0.0, 1.0, 0.0)
00038     glColor3f(0.0, 1.0, 0.0)
00039     glVertex3f(-1.0, -1.0, 0)
00040     glColor3f(0.0, 0.0, 1.0)
00041     glVertex3f(1.0, -1.0, 0)
00042     glEnd()
00043 
00044     glTranslatef(3.0, 0.0, 0.0)
00045 
00046     glColor3f(0.5, 0.5, 1.0)
00047     glBegin(GL_QUADS)
00048     glVertex3f(-1.0, 1.0, 0)
00049     glVertex3f(1.0, 1.0, 0)
00050     glVertex3f(1.0, -1.0, 0)
00051     glVertex3f(-1.0, -1.0, 0)
00052     glEnd()
00053 
00054 
00055 def main():
00056 
00057     video_flags = OPENGL|DOUBLEBUF
00058     
00059     pygame.init()
00060     pygame.display.set_mode((640,480), video_flags)
00061 
00062     resize((640,480))
00063     init()
00064 
00065     frames = 0
00066     ticks = pygame.time.get_ticks()
00067     while 1:
00068         event = pygame.event.poll()
00069         if event.type == QUIT or (event.type == KEYDOWN and event.key == K_ESCAPE):
00070             break
00071         
00072         draw()
00073         pygame.display.flip()
00074         frames = frames+1
00075 
00076     print "fps:  %d" % ((frames*1000)/(pygame.time.get_ticks()-ticks))
00077 
00078 
00079 if __name__ == '__main__': main()
